member.name: T:MGS.WebAPI.Core.ActionFilters.ActionMetricAttribute
member.summary:
An action filter which will frame the execution of an action on a controller and log a metric with Success|Failure and Timing. The filter will attempt to include contextual information about the caller (calling application and operator details) and product which is the target of the call. The caller information will be harvested from the supplied token and the product information from the Request via the extension method GetProductContext(). The Request is typically populated with the contextual product detail via the ProductResolver action filter so you should ensure that this is in use or populate Request.SetProductContext yourself.
The metric logged will have the form:
{prefix}.{Caller}.{OperatorName.{OperatorId}.{ProductName}.{ProductId}.{GamingServerName}.{GamingServerId}.{Category}.{Action}.{ServerName}.Success|Failure
{prefix} is what is typically already set up by the application in the MGS.Metrics library, e.g. api.Account
If the action succeeds (doesn't throw an exception) a LogCount() with Success is logged and a LogTiming() with the execution time. If the action fails (throws an exception) then a LogCount() with Failure is logged, as long as the exception is not suppressed (no timing is logged in this case).

member.name: T:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.ProductIdAttribute
member.summary:
Attribute which can be used to designate an integer property of a model as the one which identifies the ProductId. You would typically use this if you have model which uses a non-standard name for ProductId. It will be used by the ProductResolver action filter which sets up the product information for use by logging and metrics. If you're using one of the standard names for ProductId then you don't need to use this as the resolver will detect the it automatically.
The currently detected standard names are: "ProductId, SessionProductId, RegisteredProductId".

member.name: T:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Errors.UncertaintyTracker
member.summary: Helper class which works with the GlobalExceptionHandler to force a propagating exception to be treated as one for which the associated error response is an uncertain outcome.
member.remarks:
This is typically used as part of a multi-phase operation where, should the first part of the operation succeed but a latter part fail for deterministic reasons, the overall result must nonetheless be presented to the caller as of uncertain outcome.
For example, let's assume we are implementing an API call which needs to update a remote balance. This needs to perform the remote balance update (Step 1) and also do some updates on the local system (Step 2). Assume Step 1 succeeds but Step 2 fails with a deterministic error. We would normally present deterministic errors to the caller as such and the caller is within its rights to assume that no part of the operation has been successful. In this case however we can't allow that as only a portion of the operation has been successful so we must treat any failures, deterministic or not as "uncertain" and leave the caller in a position where it knows it needs to retry to be sure that the system has been brought back into a coherent state.

member.summary: Examines the provided exception and returns whether it should be treated as an uncertain outcome or not.

member.summary: Track the provided action and force any exceptions to be treated as an error response which is uncertain.

member.summary: Track the provided function and force any exceptions to be treated as an error response which is uncertain.

member.summary: Canonical list of Diagnostic Codes emitted from the WebAPI.Core library.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.GeneralException
member.summary: A general, non-specific exception occurred.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.InvalidIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the security principal was not a claims identify. This is serious and indicates a bug or mismatched versions.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.RequestValidationFailed
member.summary: Model validation failed. This normally indicates a malformed request from a caller.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.RequestParameterMissing
member.summary: A mandatory parameter was not supplied by a caller. See inner errors for details.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.FailedToInitialiseMetrics
member.summary: An exception occurred when trying to initialise metrics.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.SqlGeneralError
member.summary: A database error has occurred. Please see the error details for further information. If you require a specific error code for this scenario, please contact the Account Team and don't simply perform a regular pattern match against the error details as the wording could change!

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.SqlTimeoutError
member.summary: Timeout calling the database. This could be because the database is very busy or that this query was blocked by others.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.SqlDeadlockError
member.summary: Deadlock calling the database. If this occurs regularly then it's likely that the competing queries need to be optimised so that they don't interfere with one another as much.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.SqlLoginFailure
member.summary: The application cannot login to a database. This is bad, and normally indicates an incorrectly configured password in SystemConfiguration.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.IsInitialising
member.summary: Initialisation has not yet been completed. Please try again later.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.InitialisationFailed
member.summary: Initialisation failed with errors.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.ModelValidationException
member.summary: During model validation of user input, an exception occurred. This is typically because of badly formatted input which could not be bound to the expected data types.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.ModelValidationError
member.summary: During model validation of user input, an error was detected. This is typically because required values were either not supplied, or possibly supplied but out of range or not bindable to their intended data types.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.ModelValidationMultipleErrors
member.summary: Model validation encountered multiple issues. This is an outer error envelope to frame the collection. See the inner error detail for the specifics of the problems detected.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.TaskCanceled
member.summary: Normally indicates a timeout of some kind, probably as a result of an HTTP call to another API.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.NotImplementedYet
member.summary: This feature doesn't yet exist in the API, but it may well be there in a future release.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.XUserTokenHeaderMissing
member.summary: The caller did not supply a custom HTTP header X-UserToken with the UserToken which identifies the session.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.XUserTokenValueMissing
member.summary: The custom HTTP header X-UserToken is present but the value is null or whitespace, so the UserToken identifying the session is unknown.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.FailedtoGetProductInfoForMetrics
member.summary: During the course of setting up metric details, an attempt to get info about a product from SystemConfiguration failed. This typically means a ProductId which doesn't exist in the system, or network issues trying to contect the SystemConfiguration API.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.FailedToResolveProduct
member.summary: The attempt to resolve the Product details encountered an error. This could mean a ProductId which doesn't exist in the system, or network issues trying to contect the SystemConfiguration API.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.FailedToLogException
member.summary: The attempt to log an exception itself encountered an exception. This almost certainly points to a code issue as this should be very defensive code.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.FailedToProcessActionMetric
member.summary: An exception occurred when attempting to process a metric. This typically points to an issue with the suppression or error code resolution logic.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.FailedToRedactDetails
member.summary: An exception occurred when attempting to redact information prior to logging it. This almost certainly points to a code issue as this should be very defensive code.

member.name: F:MGS.WebAPI.Core.Diagnostics.Codes.FailedToLogMetric
member.summary: An exception occurred when attempting to log a metric for a token validation failure. This points to an unusual or corrupt token which can't be handled by the metric logging code.

member.name: T:MGS.WebAPI.Core.WebApiInitialisationHandler
member.summary: Singleton handler to help with the initialisation of WebApi's. Protects against potentially multiple initialisation calls.

member.name: M:MGS.WebAPI.Core.WebApiInitialisationHandler.Initialise(System.String,System.Action,System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Initialise the application. Sets up action filters which will automatically retry the initialisation when requests are made to the api (if the initialisation is not yet successful).
member.param: The name of the application. This will be used in the detail returned when the initialisation is not yet complete.

A callback which will be invoked to perform any synchronous application specific intialisation. Typically anything that interacts with the MVC or WebApi pipeline must be done syncronously to avoid any strange behaviour. Called as part of this method and whenever an action filter retries initialisation.

A callback function that returns a task which will be invoked to perform any asynchronous application specific intialisation. The optional callback allows some initialisation to take place in a non-blocking fashion. It must however return the task so it's completion can be predicted. Called as part of this method and whenever an action filter retries initialisation.

member.name: M:MGS.WebAPI.Core.WebApiInitialisationHandler.OnSuccess
member.summary: Allows external callers to invoke that initialisation was successful. This will be called internally so only needs to be done in rare cases

member.name: M:MGS.WebAPI.Core.WebApiInitialisationHandler.OnFailed(System.Exception)
member.summary: Allows external callers to invoke that initialisation failed. This will be called internally so only needs to be done in rare cases
member.param: The exception that occurred
